citation.article-title: Mesonia phycicola sp. nov., isolated from seaweed, and emended description of the genus Mesonia
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mesonia phycicola sp. nov.

Mesonia phycicola [phy.ci.co′la. L. n. phycos -i (from Gr. n. phukos) seaweed; L. suff. -cola (from L. masc. n. incola) an inhabitant of a place, a resident; N.L. n. phycicola an inhabitant of seaweed].
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, aerobic rods, 0.6–1.6 μm in diameter and 2.1–2.5 μm in length.
Devoid of flagellar and gliding motility.
On marine agar 2216, colonies are circular, convex with entire edges and yellow in colour.
Growth occurs at 10–30 °C (optimum, 25–30 °C), at pH 6.1–9.1 (optimum, pH 7.1) and in the presence of 1–12 % (w/v) NaCl.
Aesculin, gelatin and DNA are hydrolysed but agar, CM-cellulose, chitin, starch, Tween 40 and Tween 80 are not.
Acid is not produced from d-glucose or maltose.
Negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, and for arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-galactosidase activities.
d-Glucose, d-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maltose, gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate are not assimilated (API 20NE).

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase activities are present; esterase (C4), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosamidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
The major respiratory quinone is menaquinone 6 (MK-6).
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 1 G.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 30.0 mol%.
The type strain is MDSW-25T (=KCTC 22373T =DSM 21425T), isolated from seaweed collected in the vicinity of Mara Island in Jeju province, Republic of Korea.
